umontreal.ssj.mcqmctools

Class PgfDataTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • umontreal.ssj.mcqmctools.PgfDataTable

  • public class PgfDataTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a data table that could be used to produce LaTeX code to draw two-dimensional plots with the pgfplot package.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PgfDataTable(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String[] fields, double[][] data) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String drawPgfPlotManyCurves(java.lang.String title, int j1, int j2, java.util.ArrayList<PgfDataTable> listCurves, boolean loglog, java.lang.String plotoptions)
      Returns a string that contains a complete tikzpicture for the pgfplot package, showing the field j2 against field j1, for all the curves that belong to listCurves.
      java.lang.String drawPgfPlotSingleCurve(java.lang.String title, int j1, int j2, boolean loglog, java.lang.String plotoptions)
      Returns a string that contains a complete tikzpicture for the pgfplot package, showing the field j2 against field j1.
      java.lang.String formatPgfCurveAddPlot(int j1, int j2, java.lang.String plotoptions)
      Similar to @ref formatTableTwoFields, but outputs complete LaTeX code in an appropriate format that adds a curve of the field j2 against field j1 with the pgfplot package.
      java.lang.String formatTable()
      Formats the full table as a String, with the field names in the first row, and the data points (observations) in the following rows.
      java.lang.String formatTableTwoFields(int j1, int j2)
      Similar to @ref formatTable, but retains only two selected columns of the table (i.e., two selected fields), specified by j1 and j2.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PgfDataTable

        public PgfDataTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                    java.lang.String[] fields,
                    double[][] data)

    • Method Detail

      • formatTable

        public java.lang.String formatTable()
        Formats the full table as a String, with the field names in the first row, and the data points (observations) in the following rows. This format can be used directly by the pgfplot package.
        Returns:
        the table as a string.

      • formatTableTwoFields

        public java.lang.String formatTableTwoFields(int j1,
                                             int j2)
        Similar to @ref formatTable, but retains only two selected columns of the table (i.e., two selected fields), specified by j1 and j2. Note that the fields are numbered from 0.
        Parameters:
        j1 - first selected field.
        j2 - second selected field.
        Returns:
        the table as a string.

      • formatPgfCurveAddPlot

        public java.lang.String formatPgfCurveAddPlot(int j1,
                                              int j2,
                                              java.lang.String plotoptions)
        Similar to @ref formatTableTwoFields, but outputs complete LaTeX code in an appropriate format that adds a curve of the field j2 against field j1 with the pgfplot package.
        Parameters:
        j1 - first selected field.
        j2 - second selected field.
        plotoptions - is used to specify the options of addplot: addplot[plotoptions]
        Returns:
        LaTeX code as a string.

      • drawPgfPlotSingleCurve

        public java.lang.String drawPgfPlotSingleCurve(java.lang.String title,
                                               int j1,
                                               int j2,
                                               boolean loglog,
                                               java.lang.String plotoptions)
        Returns a string that contains a complete tikzpicture for the pgfplot package, showing the field j2 against field j1.
        Parameters:
        title - is the title of the plot.
        j1 - first selected field.
        j2 - second selected field.
        loglog - says if we want a log-log plot (true) or not (false).
        plotoptions - is used to specify the options of addplot: addplot[plotoptions]
        Returns:
        LaTeX code as a string.

      • drawPgfPlotManyCurves

        public static java.lang.String drawPgfPlotManyCurves(java.lang.String title,
                                                     int j1,
                                                     int j2,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<PgfDataTable> listCurves,
                                                     boolean loglog,
                                                     java.lang.String plotoptions)
        Returns a string that contains a complete tikzpicture for the pgfplot package, showing the field j2 against field j1, for all the curves that belong to listCurves.
        Parameters:
        title - is the title of the plot.
        j1 - first selected field.
        j2 - second selected field.
        listCurves - there will be one curve for each table in this list.
        loglog - says if we want a log-log plot (true) or not (false).
        plotoptions - is used to specify the options of addplot: addplot[plotoptions]
        Returns:
        LaTeX code as a string.
